Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: CInUK
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the Park Plaza and I was impressed both times. Rooms are spacious, clean, with lovely big comfortable beds. Staff are friendly and extremely helpful, and responded to any queries straight away. Location is great for The Grove shopping centre and the Farmer's Market. You are on a main road so there is traffic noise, but let's face it - you are not going to escape that anywhere in LA, unless you go up into the mountains! The hotel is on a major bus line, has its own restaurant and a coffee shop opposite. Parking is free. My only minor complaints about our room (116) would be that it had a stale smoke smell and the DVD remote control was missing but really, these were pretty teeny issues. The bathroom was big and clean, plenty of closet space, decent TV. I'd recommend this motel highly - I doubt you would get this good service for this price elsewhere in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Major Bedbug Problem”
Reviews.Author: sarahs_travels34227
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here and there was a major bedbug problem. When I showed all the bites the next morning on my son's back and legs we demanded our money back but the manager simply said to go to another motel down the road. What !! The scars on his back will probably stay there forever, but we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet, Pleasant Service, Value”
Reviews.Author: will19
Reviews.Content: There is nothing spectacular about the Park Plaza. Hower, it is clean, quiet and he staff are friendly and helpful. There is a Coffee Bean and a Diner right next to it. The beds could use new pillows! The value is great. I came here after a sleepless night at another LA hotel and this was a welcomed rest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: garuda55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here literally dozens of times during short but frequent visits to L.A. I have always had a great stay. The rooms are large and comfortable and have been upgraded with high quality beds for a good night's sleep. I don't know the details of the previous reviewer's room but I'm surprised at her commentary -- I have always felt safe here! The manager is a delightful, helpful young lady who goes out of her way to relate with her guests and is helpful with suggestions about nearby restaurants and shopping. Obviously, I never hesitate to stay at Park Plaza Lodge when visiting friends who live nearby. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms a big plus. The adjacent Fiddler's Bistro is also very good for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located and just right!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend stay (Thurs-Monday) at the Park Plaza Lodge near the Grove in Los Angeles. The hotel is small but more than adequate. It has enough updates to please most. Three of us stayed in one room (with a cot) and we managed well. Many stores, restaurants and shops are in the area with quite a few within walking distance. The Farmers Market is close for a wide variety of eating choices. We felt very safe but used common sense when walking around like you would in any large city. The hotel is right next to a restaurant. We had a great breakfast there before we started the day. There's a Coffee Bean coffee/tea shop across the street and Starbucks very nearby. Free WiFi and free parking sealed the deal for us because many other hotels charge for these amenities. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GDaddy1960
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent - so is the food at the adjacent restaurant "Fiddler's Bistro." But the scent of urine kept wafting by. At $90/night, this is a "budget" hotel for the LA area. There are few amenities (no business center nor fitness room). The beds were comfortable but the walls are paper-thin. Its best to keep your expectations low here.

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable. It was economical. Nice staff. The location is good, close to bus station and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: doofygilmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Plaza Lodge hotel twice in our California vacation and were very happy with it. The staff were friendly and very helpful and check in/out was fast. We stayed in a room on the ground floor the first time we went there and on our return, we were given a room on the second floor. The rooms were very clean and had everything that we need, including free Wifi and free parking. If you stay in a room on the ground floor, you may hear footsteps of the people in the floor above. Ask for a room in the higher floor if this bothers you. You could hear some traffic noise in the room but it didn't bother us and we all slept like babies every night. The hotel does not have a restaurant but it has a cafe located next to it. The cafe is Fiddler's Bistro and serves great breakfast. Location of the hotel is excellent and in a safe neighborhood. The Grove is about 7-10 minutes walk past a park - go out of the hotel and make a right onto W. 3rd Street. There is a 7-Eleven next to the hotel to the right. A Coffee Bean & Tea Leaves is next to the hotel on the left. There is no guest laundry in the hotel but you could go to a laundry shop 3 blocks away on W. 3rd Street to the left of the hotel and across the street. The laundry shop is called "3rd Street Cleaners" and is a laundromat and offers Wash & Fold service as well. We used their Wash & Fold service a few times - the rates are reasonable and our clothes were properly cleaned and folded. We will definitely return to the Park Plaza Lodge hotel the next time we are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel, Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ohanabuoy
Reviews.Content: I will be making this my place to stay when up in the Hollywood/Beverly Hills area. The rooms are spartan but clean. The bathroom spotless. The staff is fantastic, they remember you and call you by name. There is an on-site restaurant that serves great tasting food. I am looking for a clean room with a comfortable bed to sleep in at night. If you set this expectation you will not be disappointed when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great location, basic simple friendly place”
Reviews.Author: omegami
Reviews.Content: The reviews were right on. It's a very basic hotel, the receptionist are friendly, the rooms are clean, kind of a retro-vibe in a cute way, location is superb. Walls are a little thin though, we were walking around in the room getting ready for bed and the downstairs neighbor complained that we were being loud. The staff was very nice about it (they apologized over and over ).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Lady_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and was very impressed with the location and price. The room was spacious and had a tv, free wifi, fridge, table to eat at and a large closet. The bed was very comfortable and large (no tiny double bed). The bathroom was not special, but clean and functional. Overall, I would highly recommend it if you want a great location and comfortable stay at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: Mary A
Reviews.Content: I came out to see my son from Chicago this is truly the best hotel I have ever stayed at!!! Clean friendly and very convenient to everything. Staff makes you feel like your home

Reviews.Title: “I liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: auntceli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. My experience was the opposite of the previous poster. My room was very clean. The bathroom was immaculate. The housekeeping staff even straightened my stuff on top of the dresser every day. One day I lost my room key and the front desk staff knew my room number and made me a new one instantly. Great location right next to the Grove and Farmer's Market.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - cockroaches, blood spattered lamps and a dirty shower!”
Reviews.Author: scooby_d00_uk
Reviews.Content: Very rarely do I write a negative review. Unfortunately this hotel was a real disappointment though :-( The location is good - it's right next to The Grove, a nice park and an excellent restaurant called the Cobra and Matador. Staff on the front desk were very helpful and try their best to handle any queries. That's pretty much where the good part ends though... Rooms at this hotel are very outdated - with old looking beds and very old furniture. The furniture looked like it was a survivor of the cold war era. One day a microwave randomly turned up in our friends room - we still don't know why. Bathrooms were an ok size - but ours had leftover hair from the previous room occupants in the shower... Security doesn't seem to be top of the hotel's priority either... Our friends who were staying in an adjacent room had a plank of wood in place as a security mechanism to stop the patio door from being opened. I don't think this was really a problem for them though, as both our patio doors opened out onto a brick wall...! Perhaps the worst thing though, was a blood splattered lamp shade in one of the rooms - truly grim. Or maybe it was the pool, which is located right behind the restaurant, so you can take in the natural aroma of cooking fat whilst sunbathing or having a swim...! I did not risk actually getting into the pool for a swim... I used to work as a lifeguard and pool attendant.. Read into this what you may.... It seems as though the hotel is in need of a decent refurbishment and modernisation. I do hope the owners have the good sense to do this soon, before they lose any further potential repeat customers. Unfortunately we will not be visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Amie R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a work mate as a side trip on the way to a work conference, and what a stay. We enjoyed every day here, great customer service noting was too much trouble. The rooms are basic but comfy , clean and roomy enough for 2 people and mountains of shopping. The food and the service at the Fiddlers Bistro was AMAZING ! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service above and beyond what might be expected”
Reviews.Author: Vesth-Hansen
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and very clean. Door to the bathroom a bit to narrow though. Quiet surroundings, very nice area. Great bistro next door. Staff at reception provided the best service we have ever experienced in any hotel we have ever stayed in! They were extremely helpful and made Park Plaza Lodge home away from home. We would not dream of staying anywhere else in Los Angeles and give it our best recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: VuKk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza Lodge for 3 nights. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was nice and big, the bathroom looked almost new. Bed was nice and comfy. We had a fridge in the room which was nice as there is no breakfast at the hotel(Cafe on the opposite corner for those who want to go out for breakfast). The area is very nice, doesn't feel uncomfortable to walk at night (walked from the movies at 2.30 am). There is a big park, the Grove (shopping) and farmers market (food and shopping) close, and buses run to both Rodeo Drive and Hollywood Boulevard within walking distance. The hotel had free Parking. There is a lot of traffic on the roads, but you hardly notice it a night. Great hotel, good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice and very clean, the best hospitality in los Angeles. Would highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: txbyrdman
Reviews.Content: The lady at the desk was the nicest we meet on our trip, the rates were very reasonable, the room was super clean and nice. This was the best room we stayed in on our trip to Los Angeles. Give this one a try!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: bangles12
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, location is brilliant, very close to the Grove and farmers market and you can also walk to the Beverly centre - a great shopping centre. We arrived at about 9am and they had a room ready for us, nothing was ever a problem, room nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay..would look for something better next time”
Reviews.Author: mightygeelongcats
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the location is excellent for this hotel...I would call it more of a motel than a hotel. It is very close to Beverly hills, Universal studios, Downtown etc etc. About 45mins to Disneyland. One thing that was disappointing was the thin walls! and I mean thin walls!! you can hear EVERYTHING FROM NEXT DOOR!! Bring your earplugs. There is free parking and WIFI which is great for LA if you have a car. And i would recommend getting a car for LA as nothing is walking distance. There is also a Pool and cafe but we didn't use either as the Pool looked a bit neglected and there is a Farmers Market right next door which has fantastic food. In summary, it was ok to stay but I would spend a little more next time and get something a little more updated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: PabloPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Terrible! Shower did not have reliable hot water. TV remote didn't work; the batteries were held in using scotch tape. We checked out three hours after check-in and management was uncooperative as to refund. They seemed to not believe us about hot water or told us we should have gotten other room. Avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: klo68
Reviews.Content: Our family booked 3 rooms at the Park Plaza Lodge. We were all placed on the same floor and when we called downstairs for information, the front desk staff was aware that we all part of the same party. When we entered the room, there was a pleasant, clean aroma - not like a cleaning solution, just a sweet clean scent. There are no frills but there is free high speed internet and all rooms come with a mini fridge and we really liked that there was a seperate dressing room off of the bathroom. The hotel is next to the Fiddler's Bistro restaurant, which offers free delivery to the hotel and the hotel is in walking distance to the shopping and restaurants at the Grove. We would definately stay at the Park Plaza Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Parktraveler46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this La Brea Park hotel. We were looking for a clean, comfortable, good value, close to friends, hotel and this place fit the bill. The hotel is a 1960/70's style, but recently updated with newer furniture and bathroom fixtures. It had FREE off street parking, which is rare in this location. The room was very clean upon arrival and well cleaned by the maid between our first and second night. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful. This is not a hotel where one would plan to "hangout" or if one were looking for luxurious accommodations. If, however, you are simply looking for a clean, safe, place to sleep, it's a great value ($125.00 per night) and in a safe, convenient neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in great location”
Reviews.Author: worktoride
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel based on reviews on this site. We usually stay at hostels, this was a good choice for a little more money. This hotel is in a great location. A short bus ride from the Beverly Centre, 5mins walk from The Grove/Farmers Market. The neighbourhood was really nice and we always felt safe walking even at night past the nearby park. It was an easy walk from the Beverly Ctr to Melrose Ave past the shops and back down nice residential areas back to the hotel. The staff were always helpful and nice. The room was really spacious even with 2 double beds and was cleaned after one night. The beds were really comfortable and no bed bugs! We wernt on the road side and found it quiet, even though Im a light sleeper. The decor maybe dated, but who cares? The price is right, its safe in a safe neightbourhood and the beds are great! Didnt use the restaurant attatched, we ate at the Farmers Market. There is a Coffee Bean Cafe next door, 7/11 100mt down the road and a bank a little further.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid, clean, convenient and a good buy”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorDan5
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels in the LaBrea and Third Street / Grove area of Los Angeles. We have stayed there regularly because of convenience for the past ten years and have watched it get better and better. It is not four star, but if your expectations are a clean and comfortable hotel in the middle of LA, this is the place. The office staff is very friendly and helpful. It is located one block from the Grove and some TV studios. Over the years it has gone from the place where we had to stay to the place that we want to stay. Rates are excellent, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: paulainwales
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 10 days. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast at the fiddlers reastaurant was excellant. Good location loved the Grove and the Farmers Market both in walking distance. Needed a car but wherever you stay in Holywood would recommens as so vast. Rooms not as modern as some but clean. Would definately stay here again and recommend if on a budget and cant afford the top hotels.

Reviews.Title: “As an experienced traveller this hotel provides a 'home away from home,' and made my stay an unforgettable experience.”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence0001
Reviews.Content: To say, 'home away from home,' won't adequately describe the most comfortable stay I had. Level of service was exemplary, professional. The staff had a GENUINE regard for my well being. NICE! As an experienced traveler I'm used to a variety of hotels experiences... discovering this perfect getaway in L.A. - unexpected pleasure. Forget about the Michelin rating; this place was the best night's sleep I've ever had. Five stars plus. Bed is actually BETTER than 'Georges V' in Paris. Rooms really comfortable. Very central to my business needs. Restaurant has great food. Gave up a 'higher level amenity' hotel to extend my stay here. I'd trust them with my parents' long term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here in L.A!”
Reviews.Author: Shakiwi
Reviews.Content: We were in L.A for a few days and booked this hotel for our stay. We arrived very late, the guy behind the desk didnt offer to help carry our luggage up to our room, and there was no lift, but we were pleasantly surprised by the size and cleanliness of our room. We were then very pleasantly surprised to be greeted so warmly in the morning by a lovely young lady who asked us our itinery for the day and offered the best advice on what to do, and how to do it. She was there every day and was always so helpful! We really used her advice and she even drew us little maps and gave us invaluable information the guidebooks dont tell you! The hotel is a five minute walk from The Grove- best shopping area in L.A and the Farmers Market which saw us through for amazing breakfasts and dinners for our stay, great shopping and transport links too. We would stay here again, great value and the service was over and above what was expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great thanks”
Reviews.Author: didikaki
Reviews.Content: nice place friendly people thanks very center located for Groove farmers market and Beverly hills

Reviews.Title: “Not one thing bad to say, a wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: situationalawareness
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Los Angeles before, I was a little intimidated at choosing a hotel without ever seeing it. I also did not want to spend 200-300 a night for a room, so a balance needed to be made. This hotel is very unique, and in a great relatively quiet location. Being right next to Beverly Hills makes getting to where you want to go real easy. I love the open air architecture of the halls, also. There are air conditioners in the room that can bring the temp to close to 50 it seems! There's also Fiddler's Cafe right next to this place, and they make the greatest Mediterranean food. (try their lamb burger, it's to die for) If you want coffee in the morning, there's a Coffee Bean just across the little residential street next to the hotel, as well. If I ever go to Los Angeles again, this is the place I will go. It has everything I'd ever want from a hotel, without going overboard with silly things that I'll never need like a pool, hot tub, or tennis court. Having a 24-hour donut shop close-by helps too ;)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: sylviasydney034
Reviews.Content: The room & service gets lots of stars **** Hidden Quietly behind the Grove on the 3rd St., this turned out to be a most pleasant experience. The Hotel theme "Home away from home" lived up to its motto. Beside the bedroom & bathroom being elegantly spacious, rooms were clean, reception staff services were excellent. I've stayed at the cute farmers Daughter hotel previously and the Park Plaza Lodge is definitely on my list to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge bed!”
Reviews.Author: striderwho
Reviews.Content: I was in town for only one night before going to a business meeting so I needed to make it count - I hadn't been to LA before. This hotel/motel was great, the location was amazing, only 15 minutes walk to the Grove and Farmer's Market (I'm a slow walker) and from there I got on one of those Hop-on Hop-off bus tours and saw most of Hollywood. The room itself was had old decor but it was clean and tidy. TV was tiny but I was sick so didn't care. The bed was HUGE and high, made me feel like a queen. The bathroom was the pleasant surprise, recently renovated marble tops and everything and nice and roomy. The price was pricey to what I'm used to in Australia, but locals told me it's a great deal for something so close to everything. In short, though it's aging a bit, everything was great and the staff were very friendly so what more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MountainmanCO
Reviews.Content: Initially booked the Park Plaza because of proximity to family but will stay here on EVERY trip to L.A. Great value for a comfortable, basic room (ask for one with a digital TV on the wall) and a terrific oversized shower. Friendliest, most efficient front desk staff I've ever encountered. Excellent location just four blocks from the Farmer's Market and The Grove, plus a Whole Foods across the street from the Market. Big park two blocks away with walking trails for your morning exercise. Ample parking, fast free internet. Not fancy but very clean. Nice little restaurant next door and Coffee Grounds across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great People,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: margie011
Reviews.Content: Great Stay ! Location was exactly what I needed. Walking distance to Farmers Market, LACMA, Tar Pitts, Grove Mall and other shoping and restaurants but the best part was the very helpful staff. Had car problems and they helped

Reviews.Title: “Park Plaza Lodge great central location in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: filup
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value. It is very centrally located. Hollywood, the museums, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica pier, and downtown are only minuetes away. The Grove, a very nice shopping center, and the landmard Farmer's Market is a short walk away. Across from the Grove is K-Mart, Whole Foods and CVS. The room was clean. The bathroom looked newly renovated with new tiles and fixtures. The t.v. is the old tube style. The bathroom exhaust and the air conditioner are noisy and will compete with the t.v. We had to angle the laptop to get it to fit in the somewhat small room safe. Despite these minor shortcomings we found the staff to be very friendly, the rooms was cleaned daily, and the bed was freshly made and very comfortable. The furnishings were in very good condition. Bring your own favorite soap and shampoo if you don't want to use their stuff which is pretty cheap. I would definitely good back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great people!”
Reviews.Author: jonyagae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short trip to LA staying in the this motel near the Grove, Farmers Market and Museum row was an experience I hope to repeat often. The staff are helpful and friendly, the room is comfortable and clean. The cafe Fiddler's Bistro next door is yummalicious!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: arts1229
Reviews.Content: the place is wonderful! i mean the location is great, theres a mall near by. theres a restaurant right besides the hotel, the staff is so friendly, very helpful and prompt with my requests! i am definitely coming back here when im in town, thanks park plaza lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Why such differences in opinion?”
Reviews.Author: MrDoReaMon
Reviews.Content: It's hard for me to me to believe the variety in opinions for this hotel since I've had the same good service every time I come here. I've come to know all the people here and I feel well taken care of. That's hard to find. That's why I stay. To the person who complained about the bum, I heard about that and he was actually having a problem that needed medical treatment. And the waterbug? Maybe you had a sliding door open. You're from Miami and don't know what they are? I'm sorry, it's just frustrating to hear my favorite place getting bashed.

Reviews.Title: “Asian Gal”
Reviews.Author: asiangal07
Reviews.Content: The hotel had an outstanding location! just a couple of blocks away from The Grove and Farmers Market. Accommodations were good. The room was extremely clean. Plenty of towels were provided. It had a good price for the value and excellent parking. plus the Coffee Bean located next door. as well as The Fiddler's Bistro who has really good food too. It was so impressive, being right in the heart of the city, with people dedicated to making your stay better than you had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Homeless guy in Lobby, roaches in room”
Reviews.Author: dizzy21
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not one to write reviews but I felt compelled to write one. The staff at park plaza are pleasant and nice, but I was appalled to come back one night and find a homeless fellow sleeping in the lobby. There are alot of bums in LA I know but do they really need to sleep in the lobby of the hotel I'm paying to stay at? Also I found a total of two roaches in my room and had to run around a while to kill them. Word to the weary traveler stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBlondie
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online for my husband and his sister when they unexpectedly had to spend the night in LA after taking their mom to Cedars Sinai hospital for an in and out procedure that turned into a 2 week stay. They were very kind and not knowing how long they would need a room they held a room each day for them till about 6 p.m. They stayed 3 nights and then a week later my husband and I went back to see his mom and stayed there. They remembered my husband and were so friendly and welcoming! The room was clean, not anything special, but comfortable and clean and very affordable compared to other places close to the hospital. If we had to stay in the area again we would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in LA!”
Reviews.Author: jamesMilan_Italy
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay for my 3 days in LA, walking to The Grove and Farmers market. Soft beds, FREE WiFi, parking and a cool cafe will guarantee my return!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: tstandr
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. Hot shower, good pressure 2. Soft bed 3. Clean towels The not-so-great: 1. Flat pillows 2. No decor of any kind on the walls, kind of stark and uninviting 3. Small parking courtyard 4. Not very modern or comforting 5. Street noise 6. Loud A/C - in-window unit 7. No WiFi I read all the reviews and was optimistic. Unfortunately, I thought this hotel lacked charm and warmth. My room had no pictures on the walls and the bed was at a strange angle so you stared at a huge white wall, while the small TV was off in the corner. The A/C unit was loud, and you can't regulate the temp very well. The bed was comfy but the pillows were so flat. The room had a huge dresser in it and a small round table with two chairs, but who needs all that furniture in a one bed room? Would be better with a desk workspace or oversized chair. Oh - and no WiFi. I booked this hotel because it was less than 1/2 a mile from where I was having a meeting in the morning, but wish I'd stayed elsewhere. I paid $134 including tax for one night, one person, but feel like I could've paid the same for a brand name modernized hotel, and probably had a breakfast buffet in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, cute retro style hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSquaredNYC
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who lives nearby and said it was centrally located. It really is! It is walking distance from the Farmers Market, The Grove Mall and the La Brea Tar Pits. There is a restaurant attached where we had breakfast several mornings. The pool, while not too large, is clean and convenient. There is a 7-11 and a Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf a few doors down. Across the street is residential condos. The rooms are small and basic. It was nice to have the mini fridge in the room. I liked the retro feel of the architecture outside, very 1960's rat pack! :-) Others have complained about the noise, our room was on the back side and the only thing we heard was one morning the garbage truck came to the houses on the street. Maybe its worse if you are on the other side, but its not a major intersection with people honking or anything that extreme. Just regular "cars driving by" noise. We paid $121 per night (Wednesday thru Sunday) which was a reasonable price in my opinion. Also the woman who was usually at the front desk was very nice and gave us some advice for our trip to LA. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you really can't afford another hotel”
Reviews.Author: GXS777
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here for one night after reading the other reviews and seeing the prices for other just OK hotels in the area. The best thing was the very nice desk clerk. He made the stay acceptable. I have to say first that because he ws so nice we didn't ask for another room. I think he would have moved us but the other rooms probadly weren't much better. the Bad was the ROOM. It was dirty and had old windows with slants that wouldn't close.You could literally put your fingers through the spaces so needless to say it was COLD and Noisy. I would definilty spend some more and stay somehwhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place”
Reviews.Author: nightchef
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park Plaza Lodge simply because it was just blocks away from the apartment of a friend I was visiting; I asked her about it and she said it seemed OK. It was, indeed, OK, and a little better than OK. The service at the desk was very friendly, and the room, though not large, was clean, comfortable, and nicely furnished. Nothing fancy going on here, not a lot in the way of amenities, but if you plan to spend most of your time out and about, and just want a great deal on a nice room, this would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: lawndarts1
Reviews.Content: i used to stay at a close by hotel, but bc of the "price it right" craziness there could never get a good night's sleep. i travel to l.a. every 6 weeks for business. i started staying here about 6 months ago and have never looked back. for a woman traveling alone, this is a safe place, great restaurant attached and friendly service. the rooms have always been clean and haven't had any problems. this is a no frills place, but the location, quietness, and price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Park Plaza -- we held a family reunion there three years in a row!”
Reviews.Author: Vamills
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Park Plaza Hotel for the last 9 years, every time we came to the Los Angeles area to visit. We have enjoyed the excellent service and great accommodations so much that we have held our family reunion there for the last three years. We highly recommend the Park Plaza to anyone wanting a hotel that not only provides clean, comfortable rooms, but also friendly and professional service. The Park Plaza is close to The Grove, Farmer's Market, and other Los Angeles attractions, as well as being one block from a lovely park where guests may go to jog or picnic or enjoy other outdoor activities. We consider the Park Plaza "our other home" whenever we come to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable reservations -- we were bumped”
Reviews.Author: LorriD
Reviews.Content: I am in Los Angeles for several months with of my daughter who is being treated for breast cancer. My husband back in Sacramento came to visit last weekend. Since her apartment is small I decided to rent a room for us at a hotel about three blocks away. I called early in the week and made the reservation for Saturday night. Wednesday morning about 1:30 there was an earthquake northeast of LA. We learned about it on the morning news the next day. Thursday afternoon the hotel called the number I had given them (my cell phone, with a Sacramento area code) and told me that, since the hotel had sustained damage to several rooms, they would not be able to honor my reservation for that Saturday. I told the person on the phone that I was just across the street and that the earthquake had no impact on this neighborhood, the pictures on the wall weren't even skewed. The gentleman on the phone (who seemed to have trouble understanding me) reiterated that there was damage and that they were trying to get it fixed "sorry", then hung up. The other hotels in the area were booked. I walked across the street and they were facing a very angry woman. I was given to a person who appeared to be the owner who again told me that there had been damage, guests had been frightened and had "all came into the lobby, and I have been here since 2:30 this morning", and that the last several reservations had been canceled. I insisted on seeing some damage and she took me into an occupied room and showed me a hole -- not a crack -- in the window that looked like it was made by a projectile. I explained that I still did not believe her and I was very angry and planned to take action. They called late Friday and said that they could accommodate us after all. We declined the room. We felt uncomfortable at the prospect of staying there. There are two possibilities. (1) They had a chance for a better booking and didn't particularly mind bumping us. Their ethics are somewhat flexible. They would also have been wiser to plead a plumbing emergency or something like that. (2) They were telling the truth, with damage sustained and guests frightened in a very tiny earthquake. I wouldn't want to be staying there if there was any sort of real earthquake.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Trink
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Plaza Lodge based on its proximity to a family member's apartment. Without finding much in terms of online reviews, we felt it was a bit of a gamble...but we definitely feel we made the right bet! Room was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Furnishings may be a little less than trendy, but that was not important to us. The location allowed us to walk to several attractions, The Grove and Farmer's Market, Peterson Auto Museum, La Brea Tar Pits and LACMA. Being from the midwest, the ability to hoof it to these locales and not deal with LA traffic was ideal. Also, it was not difficult to find our way to the Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theater, etc. Used the metro (stations not too far away) to reach Chinatown and other downtown sites. For the money, we couldn't have asked for a better experience than we had at the Park Plaza Lodge. Would definitely stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Park Plaza Lodge Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6001 West 3rd Street, Los Angeles, CA 90036
